title: 'The knife is good quality. Value for money.'
body: 'The media could not be loaded. The knife is razor sharp but be careful and not use it on very hard materials. With time it losses its sharpness but i recommend using a knife sharpener from time to time. It has a good weight. A god balance and hold. A must try for budding chefs.'

title: 'Liked the knife'

title: 'Very sharp and easy to use'
body: 'I wanted to learn cooking for the past 6 months but it was very difficult with a knife that I have at home so I decided to buy a sharp life and this was one of the best brands that are available out there thus I decided to give it a try and I have been using it for the past 4 months and its just great and now I am getting better at cutting vegetable. I am very happy with this purchase.'

title: 'Rusty
body: '3.0 out of 5 stars''Not good. Only after 3-4 months of sporadic use the knife become unusable because of rust.'

title: 'My first Japanese Knife and i love it'
body: Previously i was using normal Kitchen knife But when i bout it  God i can believe how fast i can chop now (Not that fast BTW because this knife is super sharp and i have cut my finders few times [just few little cuts don't have to worry] and recommend everyone to be more careful while using it)  I love the Sharpness I love the Grip I love how the blade looks  Its just amazing

title: 'Increase weight.'
body: 'Increase the weight and if necessary increase the price too. It is a well made knife but very light. For professional chefs this is a good feature but for home cooks the knife is uncontrollable. It weighs 113 g. A 7 inch santoku must have atleast 170g.'

title: 'One of the best.'

title: 'Highly recommend knife for kitchen purpose'
body: After 1 month of usage, I'm writing this review. 1. Those who need sharp edge knife for kitchen purpose this one is good option. 2. It will be good if they provide any pouch or sachet for keeping knife safely

title: My first chef's knife
body: Wonderful knife with good sharpness and grip. This was my first proper chef's knife and I didn't regretted it. Sharpness has to be maintained by self, as is the case for every knife.

title: 'Most Desirable Knife'
body: 'I recommend Kai Hocho Santoku knife in every Indian house. Sharp and sturdy. Enjoy in cutting veggies and fruits like never before. Only thing that disappointed me was the poor packing. But excellent knife. This is my second knife. Definitely going for next one soon.'
